alert.note: Alert for Attala; Choctaw; Clay; Kemper; Leake; Lowndes; Montgomery; Neshoba; Noxubee; Oktibbeha; Webster; Winston (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 01 at 4:35PM CDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT CHOCTAW...LEAKE...WESTERN NOXUBEE...WESTERN KEMPER...OKTIBBEHA...ATTALA...WINSTON...WEBSTER... MONTGOMERY...NESHOBA...CLAY AND SOUTHWESTERN LOWNDES COUNTIES THROUGH 530 PM CDT... At 434 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Pala Alto to near Mashulaville to near House. Movement was west at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Starkville, Philadelphia, Union, Tucker, Longview, Pheba, Burnside, Betheden, Millcreek, and Craig Springs around 440 PM CDT. Louisville, Noxapater, Dixon, Montpelier, and Stallo around 445 PM CDT. Sturgis around 450 PM CDT. Pearl River, Maben, Mantee, Cumberland, Mcmillan, and Dowdville around 455 PM CDT. Mathiston, Madden, Sherwood, Reform, and Clarkson around 500 PM CDT. Ackerman and Edinburg around 505 PM CDT. Walnut Grove, Standing Pine, and Chester around 510 PM CDT. Eupora, Weir, Walthall, and Zama around 515 PM CDT. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Attala; Choctaw; Clay; Kemper; Leake; Lowndes; Montgomery; Neshoba; Noxubee; Oktibbeha; Webster; Winston
